Great Questions!   I have had vaginal bleeding during bowel movement too.  It occurs only once per month but very predictably a couple days before my period.  This has  been going on for several years. ( as backgound, I am 40, two kids, never had endometriosis and do not have it now.  Get regular colonoscopy and exams, thin prep and PAPs always negative, 28 day cycle)Ugly details:  After BM, bright red blood in commode and on toilet tissue.  (positive that it is vaginal, not rectal) the curious thing is that once it happens there is no residual bleeding at all.  No further spotting on the same day, no darker blood, nothing.  Happens once per cycle and that is it until next month.Diagnoses:  Had Uterine Hystosonogram done (ultrsound with water) to better see if any polyps present.  Found at least two tiny polyps in uterus. They were clearly visable even to my untrained eye. Scheduled day surgery to have them removed and to biopsy tissues just in case.Once doctor went in, could not find the polyps.  She took tissue samples for biopsy.Biopsy came back all clear for cancer, but pathology showed that I have a 'disorganized endometrium'.  This was explained as follows:  When looking at the cells of uterine lining, they should all present at pretty much the same stage of your cycle.  IE: if you are on the 10th day of your menstrual cycle,  all of the lining cells should look about 10 days old (for simplicity sake).  My cells were 'disorganized' with some presenting at 5 days, some at 15, some at 21 etc.This might explain the cause of the off cycle bleeding.  My doctor put me on birth control pills for 3 months and then wants to do another biopsy in November.  She said the BC pills should kick my lining back onto the right schedule.I am skeptical.  If this were the cause of the bleeding, then logically, I should be experiencing inconsistant spotting at least a couple times per month, rather than the very consistant 'two days before' situation I explained earlier.I started on the BC pills in July.  When I was close to the date that my period should start on the pill, I had the exact same bleeding two days before onset.I am now into the second month...we will see what happens next.I am interested in anyone else's experience and outcome which was diagnosed similarly or due to non-endormetriosis reasons.

I have had this problem for more than a year.  My paps have been LGSIL and after a LEEP in Jan '07 CIN II was found (unclear margins) and the LGSIL paps persisted until Feb '08.  Now I have a ASCUS pap but the bleeding continues.  In Oct '07 I had a large polyp removed with biopsies of the surrounding area--all negative.  I also had a D&C which was normal too.  The oncology group that is treating me recommends a hysterectomy because the bleeding that I am having, and everyone else in this thread, is not that normal.  I am sure there could be different causes in each case.  I would really like to know what mechanism is triggering this.  My bleeding issues start after mid cycle, usually day 20 of my 28 day cycle and get worse until my period starts.  I will post after my hysterectomy to let those interested know if anything was discovered.

It's bizarre how everyone has such similar stories and symptoms.  I have been having vaginal bleeding during bowel moments and sex for the past 2 or 3 years.  Three doctors later, I'm no closer to finding an answer.  I have had multiple pelvic exams and paps, a sigmoidoscopy, a diagnostic laparoscopy, a sonagram, and an endometrial biopsy, and the doctors cannot find anything.  I have been tested for STDs, all of which have been negative.  Each doctor I talk to has a hard time believing that the bleeding is vaginal and not rectal (hence the sigmoidoscopy), which makes me even more frustrated.  Also, each doctor starts out gung ho and assures me that they will find the reason, but then after a few paps and a minor procedure or two they brush me off and basically tell me to live with it.  The problem gets progressively worse as time goes by.  I am starting to experience pelvic pain (similar to menstrual cramps) after the bowel movements.  I am also now having menstrual cramps and PMS for the first time in almost 10 years (I've been on the pill for that long and am still on it).  I did recently switch pills from Trinessa to Low Ogestrel, but the bleeding and cramping started well before I switched.I don't want to just accept it and let it go because I am afraid that if there is a problem, I want to find it now and not later when it could be much worse.  I'm tired of bleeding and cramping without knowing why, and I'm tired of being dismissed by doctors who can't find a quick answer.  Please please post if any of you have found answers.  There has to be a reason as to why we are all having the same problem.
Quick edit:  That line about being dismissed by doctors at the end was supposed to say "I'm tired of being dismissed by doctors who give up because they can't find a quick answer."

I just found out that I miscarried my pregnancy.  Though the doc couldn't (wouldn't) say exactly what happened, I think it has to do with this bleeding problem.  The fetus was too small for its developmental age and wasn't properly attached -- which I believe is due to undiagnosed endometriosis.  I had spotting and bleeding through the entire (unsuccessful) implantation process.  It's common for women with endo to have this problem.  I also read that sometimes women have a connection between the uterus and the colon/rectum that causes tugging and bleeding in the uterus when a bm passes through the colon/rectum.  That connection could be endo related.  Without laproscopy, we can't know if it's endo.  Regardless, I thought some of you may be interested in my theory.

I posted back in March that I was having a hysterectomy due to all the problems I have been experiencing.  I have had dysplasia and abnormal paps for two years and even though I knew there was little chance all the strange bleeding symtoms were indicative of something more serious, I was unwilling to undergo any more procedures or surgeries to resolve this.  I had my hysterectomy and the only thing found was adenomyosis.  Aside from the bleeding, I have had a lot of problems with pelvic pain which is from the adenomyosis.  I am 45 years old and done with having children so this was a good option for me.  I no longer have to worry about dysplasia and paps every 3 months.  One thing to keep in mind, though, is that a negative pap smear does not mean that one does not have cervical cancer.  Please keep on top of these bleeding issues you are experiencing and make sure you are comfortable with the doctor treating you!Matina

After several years and many doctors I FINALLY found a doctor that has seen this problem before. After an examination, she referred me to a Women's hospital here in Vancouver to see if I was a candidate for cryo-surgery. After an exam with a camera the doctor determined that it was not my uterus bleeding, but my cervix was VERY sensitive and would bleed to the touch, and like many of you here during bowel movements, sex, even sitting too long. He mentioned that this cryo-surgery (freezing of the spot that is bleeding on the cervix) may only have an 85% success rate but assured me that I was a good candidate and it leaves very little scar tissue. We went ahead with the procedure right there in the exam room, it took about 10 minutes. It has been over 4 weeks, and since the healing process has been over I have had a NO problems, and NO MORE BLEEDING! I am so relieved, I have not seen a spot of blood since the surgery and I am able to continue my life as normal!!! I just wanted to give you all an update as I too was lost and confused for many years about this mystery that seems to be quite common and uncomplicated after all...

At age 30, started spotting mid-cycle and on strained bowel movement. This coincided with my moving to Canada and I thought that the patch in Canada might be a different type/ dose, hence causing the mid-cycle bleeding. Family doctor checked my pap results, said there are no problems and to live with it, since it's just an 'annoyance.' Went to another family doctor a few months later, who suggested I go off Evra and back on to a 'lighter dose' pill. This didn't help, but then I stopped taking the pill altogether (Jan 2008) in order to try to conceive. Took me 6 months.I am now 31 and 16.5 weeks pregnant. Early in the first trimester I had some light bleeding on and off. Had a pap smear at 8 weeks pregnant, and when the doctor removed the speculum, I bled a LOT, which totally freaked me out. Doctor said he could see blood pooling in my cervix. I had an ultrasound and the baby is fine.I had no further bleeding until 15 weeks, when the bleeding on bowel movement started again. It is bright red and I can feel it dripping in the toilet. I've now also started bleeding after sex. I have read this is due to a softened cervix during pregnancy. Whatever the reason, it's pretty scary especially when pregnant!My prenatal care has been transferred to an OB-GYN and had my first appointment today. Seems my pregnancy multivitamin is making me somewhat constipated, so my OB is switching me to another. She did not seem concerned otherwise about the bleeding, so we'll see what happens.

I just got back from the OB, with the symptoms of bleeding with bowel movement about a week to a few days before period... She did a pap smear, and looking at the cervix she said that the end of my cervix has many blood vessels right there.  She said that with any amount of straining they would easily bleed.  Also she said sex could easily irritate and bleed. In fact when she brushed the giant Q-tip across it; it bled.  She said that I could have cervicitis.  I am not sure what the treatment is, but I will find out when my pap comes back.  I will post again.Side bar, when I looked up cervicitis, it showed the main cause we be a prior or recient STD, however I have only had 2 partners in my life so It also can be caused by other reasons... So don't rule it out if the common causes don't fit your description

Finally after 13 monthes and 3 doctors, I finally have gotten an answer to why I have constant vaginal bleeding, and also after bowel movements. I have a mass of blood vessels on my cervix which makes my cervix bleed even with just a touch.  My options for stopping the bleeding were 1.To have them frozen several times over the next year, with no guarentee that it would be succesfull or that it wouldn't return. 2. To have a hysterectomy removing only my cervix and uterus leaving my ovaries.  I have opted for option 2.  I just want my life back  Hope this helps!!!!

Hey there ladies,I've got the answer and it *****! We are women and this is all part of what are hormonal bodies go through. There is nothing wrong, it's just like getting a pimple on your face! it happens, goes away and then comes back again. more often than we want though! You probably notice that when you use force to pass your bowels, you have a greater amount of blood on the tissue or in the bowl...you are breaking capillaries. After sex, the walls and lining are thinner and well, there is alot of thrusting going on. You bound to break something!! ☺Let us all know...we are ok, we are not sick, it's just one of those things we are dealing with, hate it...but we are not contagious and we are not dying or on the road to a serious illness because of it. An update on my side - my pregnancy has progressed without major complication. I am now almost 34 weeks along.Meg - if it's any consolation, I conceived relatively easily despite having this problem (see my background posted in September).Since September, the bleeding stopped for a few weeks, came back, went away, came back etc over the past few months, and is currently not a problem.My OB wasn't too concerned in first to mid-second trimester, but is a bit worried about bleeding in third trimester; so I was referred to Sunnybrook's Odette Cancer Centre, to the specialist in the colposcopy department.The specialist there had a look and did another pap smear (which came back as normal, as have all of my paps), and says he sees *normal* glandular changes, but it is unusual that I have quite a bit of mucous discharge and bleeding. However, due to my pregnant state he cannot do anything further or take a cervical biopsy, so I am scheduled to see him 4 weeks after delivery. All in all, though, he does not seem overly concerned yet, so that is heartening. I am now just awaiting the arrival of my baby and we'll see what happens from there.

My gosh, I can so relate to most of the comments. I too have been in this boat of wonderment and inconclusive testing. I am 33 years old and have had two children and in July of 2007 I began having pain in my groin area. In October I was referred to a general surgeon who thought I probably had two small hernia's and would have to deal with the pain until they were big enough to repair...flash forward to July 2008 and alot of pain later. I had an exploratory Laprascopy and my OB/GYN found some endometriosis. My pain and issues since then have really been tough. I found out I was pregnant less than a month after my surgery in July of 2008 and my vaginal drainage and bleeding ceased for about 2 months during my pregnancy...but something still didn't feel right. We found out on Halloween of 08 that we had lost the baby. I was 12 weeks pregnant but the babys' heart had stopped at 10 weeks as well as it's growth. I opted to have a procedure the very next day to remove the baby and pregnancy. I proceeded to have continued bleeding/clotting/pain...my doctor kept reassuring me that it was normal and he had removed everything, even after me explaining that there was still tissue coming out. I finally convinced him to check my hormone level, which was still elevated. After a few more weeks of the same symptoms, he convinced me to come into the office and he would easily suck the rest of the pregnancy out, and that I could tough out the pain and it would be over in a few seconds. When I got to the office he ultrasounded and found the remaining tissue and when he tried to "easily" suck it out, it would not budge. The suction procedure turned into a D and C, which is an actually scraping of my uterus. This being the same procedure I had originally had under general anesthesia. This was painful. Even after that 3rd procedure it still took my body time time complete the loss. Overall, it was about 1 1/2 months of agony. With the dr trying to convince me that everything was ok and that I needed to just try to forget about it. Now my current symptoms are browninsh to bloody to light tissue type drainage, this happens everytime I sit on the toilet whether I am peeing or having a bowel movement. I do bleed heavy with intercourse as well and it last for days at a time. As you can imagine alot of days go by that I am not wanting my husband to touch me or think about having sex with me. I feel so guilty because I know how much he loves me and how much he wants to. At this point, he has told me to just let him know when I am ready. I have been back to the dr and his nurse midwife. They have said that I have a "friable" cervix and it's all normal. But have no ideas to help my situation. I am really insecure about the drainage and have to wear at least a panty liner on a daily basis. This has definitely gotten worse, yet they say it's normal. I feel like I am going crazy. My dr. made a comment to me, "it's not like you have cancer or something". I really don't feel heard but I don't feel too encouraged that any other dr would be able to help me either. I don't know where to go from here. We do plan on trying to get pregnant again but not until May or later. But that's kind of difficult when you aren't really having much of a sex life either. Awe, the difficulties of woman hood.

What a relief to find you all!!  I hope most of you that haven't posted in a while have found relief or cure...Here is my story:I am 33 years old with no children.  I have had irregular periods my entire life but they had been regulated since the age of 16 by birth control pills.  No history of STD of any kind, but my PAPs have usually been irregular.  Colposcopy at the age of 21 with no abnormalities.  Continually been PAPed and taken every BCP in the book.At 29 I started bleeding MORE than normal, nearly 3 out of 4 weeks.  At this time I was not sexually active and not taking any BCP.  Contacted a OBGYN and was treated for nearly three years without much of an answer.  Every different BCP I tried did not help the situation.  I was told I had cervical ectropion due to taking the pill for so long: basically, the cervix's internal cells had begun to grow on the outside of the cervix and that was making it bleed to the touch.  Well, I'm certainly not touching my cervix but bleeding every other day it seems, especially when I have a bowel movement.  Usually the blood is bright red, with clots, other times it is darker brownish red.SO I WAS prescribed the Nuvaring vaginal ring and that did help quite a bit.  Much, much less bleeding between periods and none with bowel movements.  The doctor did not know why the Nuvaring worked, but thought maybe it had something to do with the drugs not having to go through the liver.  However, when the ring is removed for one week to allow for a period, the period does not come until I insert an entirely NEW Nuvaring to start a new 28- day cycle.  Weird.The unfortunate conclusion to this story is that Nuvaring is not covered by insurance and costs more than $50 per month out of pocket - which I do not have now that I'm unemployed.  SO I am once again bleeding every other day and with bowel movements.  Lets hope this economy gets back on track so that I can start living a 'somewhat' normal life again...

Hello there, it has been a while since I posted.  I am currently undergoing some fertility testing, and today I had an HSG (Hysterosalpingogram) which is where they inject dye into your uterus to make sure it travels freely through your fallopian tubes.  Basically to see if everything is "open for business."  Well, the left side looked normal, but the dye going to the right side got completely blocked by something in my uterus - possibly a polyp.  I have been trying to conceive for a year and this polyp might not only be blocking that one tube, but it may be creating a hostile environment for an embryo.  And, to the concerns on this list, it turns out that polyps can cause the kind of spotting and bleeding we have all been experiencing.  I am going to schedule a procedure to take it out as soon as possible and see where we go from there.  If you google uterine polyps, you'll find more information on this.  Incidentally, when I had an ultrasound a few weeks ago, the doctor also noticed a white mass that he thought was unusual and could be causing the spotting in between periods.  So hopefully we have found the culprit.  This is my second HSG (the first was before my son was born) and I highly recommend the procedure as it really shows whether you have any blockages or not.

The last time I posted was January 25th. Alot has happened since then...I was referred to an M.D., by a close friend, who specialized in "holistic care" or "naturopathy type care. Before my first visit he had me fill out a 13 page questionaire and during my  1 1/2 hour, first visit, with him, he highlighted all the concerns he had with my symptoms and then proceeded to ask  me more about them. He didn't make me feel rushed and he seemed to enjoy the investigation part of the appointment. By the end of the appointment, he had about three different ideas and he then ordered about 15 different lab tests to verify what he thought could be wrong. The most different part of the appointment was at the end he said to me, "I will be able to help you with these problems". I had to question what he said, and he again assured me, "yes, I will be able to help you". I wanted to cry. I told him no one else had told me that in the past 1 1/2 years. It was more of " well sorry you are having these things happen in your life/body, but there isn't anything we can do". This really gave me newfound hope, strength and reinforcement that what was going on wasn't right and that someone else could actually help my symptoms. Some of the most significant lab tests results were my estrogen, progesterone and growth hormone levels. To remind you I was on birth control pills from age 18 to age 27. At that point I got pregnant and proceeded to either be pregnant or be breastfeeding for the next 4-5 years, including my miscarriage pregnancy. I didn't use any birth control pills during these years. In July of 2008, I had surgery for endometriosis. And then immediately got pregnant within that next month. I had my miscarriage in November. And then had two D/C's due to retained tissue. I had irregular bleeding as well as many other symptoms like pms-type symptoms, always feeling cold, exhaustion, mild depression, loss of appetite, nausea, irregular bowel movements, headaches, frequent illness to name a few. In December, I decided to go back on birthcontrol pills. My nurse midwife thought it would help my symptoms and I for sure didn't want to get pregnant at that point. So I was on Yaz up until this month. Typically, when you are on birth control pills it does decrease your own hormones like progesterone, estrogen, and growth hormone. A typical estrogen level while on birth control pills would be a minimum of 100 but optimal would be 200 level....mine was only 20. This blood test was done on day 20 of my cycle. My doctor told me that this would be a typical level of a man!! My progesterone and growth hormone were also much lower than they should have been.He suggested I stop my birth control pills at the end of this cycle. He also found that my serum iron level was extremely low as well as my vitamin D level and a thyroid level was off as well. My thyroid level has been checked before and it was always within normal limits but he took it a step farther and did many other thyroid checks along with my temperatures that he had me take during my period, this showed there is some insufficiency with my thyroid. Not enough to put me on Synthroid or the like but enough that it could be effecting my cycle and bleeding. So I am now taking many supplements here are a few....prometrium(progesterone), vitamin D, Iron, Zinc, prenatal vitamin, Iodine(for the thyroid issue), DHEA. Then once I finish this packet of Yaz I will stop taking them and start taking an estrogen gel from day 4-28. This is a gel that I will rub into my thigh. This will allow my own natural hormones to start building again and with the combination of the other supplements start regulating my entire system. I have also been checked for food allergies in the past and found to be sensitive to yeast both bakers and brewers. That alone can cause many multi system issues. So he has me on difulucan for 10 days to help kill any extra yeast in my body.He said it will take a few cycles to get me regulated and from that point on we will determine how healthy I feel to try to get pregnant again. I urge all of you to search for a M.D that will really "hear" what your concerns and symptoms are. It's amazing to actually have an appointment with an M.D. who is familiar with all of these things and is confident in being able to make a change for the better in your life. I have found since I have been taking the prometrium(progesterone) that I don't have the irregular bleeding, like during bowel movements and sex etc...I can only imagine what changes will take place once I get my estrogen level to a healthy number. I would like to mention my OB/Gyn never once checked my estrogen/progesterone level while I was under his care. Good luck to you all and I will keep you updated through this process.

Hi,I'm new, and I've never posted anything to any forum before, but when I saw all your stories, I could totally relate!  Some info I received from my doc in February may help you.  I am 36 and my hubby and I have been ttc for 8 mos.  In February, 5 days after my ovulation predictor kit was positive, I was in the bathroom, having a BM and felt a gush and sure enough, bright red, definitely vaginal, not rectal, blood.  I panicked and wondered if I had an early ectopic pregancy burst or something like that.  I had no pelvic pain or pressure, just a regular bathroom visit.  It stopped fast but seemed like a lot of blood quickly so I went to the ER and an ultrasound showed I'd had a hemorrhagic ovarian cyst just burst.  I was surprised but apparently these are quite common, can re-occur (yippee) and are considered "functional". They are formed after you ovulate and the corpus luteum folds back on itself and traps blood which may continue to accumulate and can burst on its' own or during a bowel movement when there's more pressure in the pelvis.  The ultrasound also showed I have a subseptate uterus and we're being referred to a fertility specialist but our appt is not until June.  I have been having brown spotting usually the last 10 days or so before my period since I went off the Pill in September.  This was so different looking than that though.  Today, same thing happened again and I'm 10 days past the positive ovulation predictor kit, so I can only assume it's another cyst that just burst.  I just have some light brown spotting now, no blood.  Sigh. This is so frustrating but when I checked out some other internet sites about the hemorrhagic cysts, it does indeed say that it can happen over and over.  Grrrr.  I had no problems of any sort prior to going off the Pill.  This all started when I went off.  I am so anxious to conceive and we are so excited to have a baby so this is pretty scary, but I'm hoping it's "just the hemmorhagic cysts" and am very interested in what the fertility doc says when we see him in June.  Hang in there, everyone.  Maybe we are all okay after all?

I  have had this same problem, bleeding with bowel movements, after sex, irregular menstrual cycle. This has been ongoing and bothersome for months.I found a doctor who listened, and did the appropriate tests- ultrasound of my uterus and a transvaginal  ultrasound. He has found I have a Uterine Polyp. This is how he explained it to me..The polyp is located on the fundus part of the uterus. Whenever I contract my uterus, for a bowel movement, sex, exercise,- it squeezes the polyp causing it to bleed. He is going to do a simple out patient procedure called a hystoscopy to remove it. So all should be well.I will post anymore information I learn after my procedure.Just be persistent with your physician for him/her to order the appropriate test, dont give up!!!

After reading all these, I am relieved in a way to know I am not alone.  Here's my story and input.  I have had this abnormal bleeding (after BM and during/after intercourse) for about a year.  First they said I it could be polyps, which they removed.  Still bled.  Then they did a D & C because they said my lining was too thick.  Still bled.  Next they wanted me try BC pills.  Still bled.  So they did a MRI of my pelvis which showed that I have a condition called Adenomyosis.  This is a condition where the uterine lining grows back in to your uterine lining.  Which leads to shedding, which appears to be more prevalent during a bowel movemnt or intercourse.  This is common in women ages 35 and up who have already had children, and the only real cure is a hysterectomy.  However, I am only 28 and have no children.  So this is not an option.  Not sure what to do at this point.  I hope this helps!!!

I was just diagnosed with GI Endometriosis.  Endometriosis can grow on any organ, including bowels, intestines, etc.  Many times when a woman has GI Endo it can cause bleeding with bowel movement.  Endo can also be the cause of fertility problems.  Just thought I'd let you all know that I finally found out what the heck was happening with my health!  It is a relief to know what the problem is!Best of luck to all.

First and foremost I found this while reading:I found some information online about those of you who have had children, pelvic surgery, or a hysterectomy, as far as the bleeding after BM's: sometimes the lining between the rectum and the vagina can stretch, strain, or tear, causing bleeding from the vagina.  It's called a rectocele or an enterocele.  Has anyone had this diagnosis?  It is pretty rare for those who don't fit into one of the above categories, but I suppose it's possible.  Treatment can be as simple as taking stool softeners, but can go all the way up to surgery.  Let me know!This is my story:I've been reading this thread, and like most of you am relieved that I am not alone.  Without retelling my whole story, basically I am the same as many of you: bleeding during or after intercourse (on and off for a few years, but not every time) and just recently bleeding after a BM.  I haven't gone to the gyno about the most recent symptom, but have been for the other.  I'm 26, no children, and have been on some form of BC for almost 8 years because off of it I have extremely painful and irregular periods.I've had all the tests you can think of, minus the endo procedure: Pap's, colonoscopy, ultrasounds, STD tests.  No polyps, cysts, STD's, etc.  My gyno told me that I may have a sensitive cervix, like many of you have also said, but I've done the silver nitrate and the cryo with little or no results.  It always comes back.Then my doctor said it may be from my birth control, so we changed that 3 times.  No lasting changes.Then they said I had minor yeast and bacterial vaginosis (BV) infections, to which they prescribed basic meds.  These usually don't cause bleeding though, so I was skeptical.  The symptoms came back, as always.I still don't have answers and have been to 3 doctors.  There is still always the possibility of endo, but I don't want to do that belly-button procedure :(  If anyone even has suggestions, I'd be happy to hear them :)  Good luck everyone!

Hi all-I have had bleeding before my periods, after intercourse and also occasionally after bowel movements for ~3 years. All tests came back normal and my doctors haven't been able to figure out what's going on.This year, I moved and went to a new doctor for my annual exam. He said that I have cervical ectropion (google it to find more info), which he could see during the colp. exam that he did. It's apparently a harmless condition that is associated with being on the pill-- I'm not on the pill but was for 10 years. It occurs when endometiral cells are present on the cervix, and he said it just happens sometimes. He said he can remove the cells (by freezing) if it's very bothersome, but would prefer to do nothing.I can't even begin to say what a relief it is to find out what's wrong. For years I've been worried everytime some bleeding occurs. I hope this helps someone else!!

Like all of you here, I am sharing the same symptoms, medical tests/experiences, and lack of information... and can echo how nice it was to find so many women talking about it!  By the same token, I can also echo your frustration!!!!  In an effort to sound an alarm, I wrote this letter to the two main OB/GYN societies in the U.S...  I just thought to share it with you (I hope you all don't mind that I included a link to this forum!) I don't expect an answer, but if I hear one I will certainly post again!"To Whom It May Concern atThe American Congress of Obstetrics and Gynecologistsand The American Gynecological and Obstetrical Society,Thank you so much for taking the time to read this letter and for providing any assistance or information you may have to offer!  I will be as brief as I can be.In seeking answers to my own persistent symptoms of unusual vaginal bleeding over the last few years (with three different doctors) and finding no explanations, I turned, as many women do, to online sources for OB/GYN information.  In doing so, I discovered hundreds of women - of all ages and stages, with or without children - talking about exactly the same symptoms of a particular kind of vaginal bleeding and how they have all been "living with it" without accurate diagnoses for years.  I know that the internet is not necessarily a reliable source; however, I was mainly struck by how many of us describe the exact same experience - and the exact same frustration at finding no clear answers or solutions from our doctors. They seem to be STUMPED!  (Here is one example of such a discussion:http://www.medhelp.org/posts/Womens-Health/Vaginal-bleeding-after-during-sex-and-with-a-bowel-movement/show/31554)  So I am reaching out to you, as leaders in the OB/GYN profession, to seek guidance and some insight into the medical discussion of this topic.  I'm sure for every woman who has shared their symptoms with their doctors or online, there are many others who have not.Most commonly, this vaginal bleeding occurs at the same time in our cycles - after ovulation, during the luteal phase (beginning a few days up to 2 weeks prior to menstration and continuing until menstrual bleeding) - and can be seen during bowel movements or after/during sex.  The bleeding is most certainly vaginal, either bright bright red and dripping into the toilet or old and brown when we wipe.  For most of us, we have regular menstration and this is distinct from that.  Some have experienced pain along with this bleeding, but not all.  In addition to these shared symptoms, we all have one other important thing in common; our doctors have tried out many possibilities and found "NOTHING WRONG."  Almost all of us have been to multiple GP's and OB/GYN's (in addition to GE's) and have had a whole range diagnostic procedures, thankfully ruling out cervical and uterine cancers, polyps, fibroid tumors, endomedriosis (some have it; most do not), vagicitis, and everything else under the sun.  Some of us have been told we might have things like "disorganized endometrium", "friable cervix", "Tilted Uterus", "Hemorrhagic Cysts" -  with procedures suggested that are more frightening than the original symptoms. Often these procedures - including hysterectomy - fail to stop the bleeding.  ALL of us have been on Oral Contraceptives (pill, nuvaring, IUD, etc.) and the onset of these symptoms begin to occur while taking them or after we stop.  Some women have even being prescribed them to help with these symptoms, with no result.  A few women seem to have had some success monitoring their hormone levels and increasing their body's natural production of progesterone (through natural creams, synthetic depositories, herbal medicines, and acupuncture) - learning from some wisdom in fertility treatments.  But many others have said that their doctors have refused to test their hormone levels. (For instance, my doctor did everything she could think of and then told me it was probably "hormonal" and, basically, to live with it (though my uterus is a little tilted.)  Others had doctors who were flat out dismissive, never heard of anything like it, or thought they were inventing it.))  Some have begun to try food allergies and to change their diets.  Results of all of this pending.Obviously, such cyclical and frequent vaginal bleeding interferes with our daily functioning, sexual and relationship health, and stress levels.  Additionally, we have many fears about - and many different success rates of - healthy conception and delivery.  Most importantly, all the women sharing their stories have also expressed extreme disappointment and frustration in the lack of expertise and knowledge about the topic by medical professionals, even when their symptoms have persisted for many years (in some cases decades).  It is possible that many OB/GYNs have seen these cases more than others, but this expertise does not seem to be widely shared.  I understand that every woman's body is different, that we all have different experiences/biologies/genetics/personal histories, and that there may be many factors.  However, it is surprising that our stories are all the same, and we are still left with so many questions.  Perhaps there is something broader going on - something environmental, dietary, or a shared side effect?  At the very least, if we had the information, we could made more responsible decisions.Can you tell me/us:  Is this topic being raised in discussion between OB/GYN doctors?  Is there any current research on these symptoms and possible causes?  Is anyone sounding any alarms about birth control, environmental toxins, food industry changes, or other hard-to-pinpoint possible causes of unusual vaginal bleeding late in the menstrual cycle?  (Is anyone presenting anything on the topic at your upcoming Conference in Chicago?)  If so, I hope that doctors will begin to share their knowledge and disseminate information more widely, so that the women going through this can feel more understood, listened to, cared for, taken seriously, and brought back to normal reproductive and sexual health - the main goals of your practices.Thank you so much for reading, and I hope to hear from you soon!"---

I must say, reading this has both calmed me down (knowing that others have my same issue and it's not life threatening) and made me nervous (seeing as many of you haven't been able to get answers...like myself). I've had vaginal bleeding during and after sex, and also when straining during BMs, for upwards of 5 years now.  I've seen two doctors and they have no clue what's going on with me.  My PAPs and ultrasounds are normal.  During my exam, when the doc touched my cervix it would bleed.  I too have been told I have a sensitive cervix.  At my last visit (April 2013) I tested positive for Ureaplasma. My doc said they recently starting testing for this with PAPs and it's actually very common.  I guess it's something that occurs naturally within a man and is sexually transmitted.  Both myself and my husband were treated with an antibiotic and we are now clear of it. So, I'm wondering if Ureaplasma has come up with anyone else?  I know this post is old, but the information is still relevant.

Hi I am a 38 year old female, never had children about 8 months ago i started getting dark vaginal bleeding with stringy clots. My periods were always regular and the bleeding in between is a daily occurance, however i have noticed the blood is heavier and bright red when i have a bout of constipation or pass a hard BM. I have been to four different doctors, referred to two different gynos, one said endemeterious, then said it was not that, the other said ovarian cysts on either ovary however they are to small to remove, I am booked in for a further blood test this week as the last CA125 blood test was unusually high. I have now noticed my periods have stopped on the normal due date started to come 2 weeks later that happened last month and again i have passed the original date this month so expecting it this week about 18th will wait and see.I also had one doctor say it could be the start of menopause. I am trying natural remedies which has stopped the blood during the day but its there when i wake up and have first bowel movement and now stools have been soft for 3 weeks. I take raw natural coconut oil 1 Tea spoon every day and 1 tea spoon of Munukka honey 15+ UMF, I have cut out sugar in tea mostly all junk food, especially fried food from takeaways this seems to help with general health around and the weight just seems to stay off something good out of this depressing situation hope this helps other sufferers

Hi.I've also have slight vaginal bleeding after orgasm or a bowel movement.  As though its the 'push down' that causes it.  I had an abnormal smear test result and tested positive for HPV and was cin2.  Had lletz ( laser) treatment and am all fine now.  This bleeding started after my colposcopy and lletz treatment.  I am now clear of HPV and my smear is normal.  It wasn't until I spoke to the nurse and my GP and they said this can be quite common when you are ovulating, if your body has been under stress.I am not medically trained in any way.  So please get checked out before you drive yourself crazy!!  X x x

I'm 39, have 2 children.  After my 2nd child was born I started taking the birth control pill Cerazette.  Soon after I started suffering nausea, abdominal pain and anxiety so after 3 months I stopped taking it.  The symptoms eased immediately but over the next few months gradually came back.  After about a year of suffering with the symptoms I went to the doctors and had a lot of tests all negative.  He told me I have IBS.  Now nearly 5 years later I have started experiencing vaginal bleeding after a bowel movement.  Happens when bowel movements are hard and difficult to get out, about 5 days before my period is due.  Doctor is not concerned.  He has tested me for bowel and ovarian cancer and ruled those out.  Interesting that a lot of people have mentioned IBS.

Check out this thread too...http://www.medhelp.org/posts/Womens-Health/vaginal-bleeding-with-bowel-movement/show/32315I wrote on that thread what is below but after reading this, I feel like I should throw in some more information. I had PID when I was 18, then also had a miscarriage and a D&C. When I was 19 I got a pos HPV at my pap. They did a cone biopsy on my cervix and LEEP surgery and I never had another pos test. I had my first child at 22 and my second at 31. I also have IBS and am overweight.I am a married 37yo with a 15yo and a 6yo. This same thing started with me a little over a year ago. About a week or so before my period, when I have a BM I bleed. Sometimes it's a lot, sometimes it's a little, but I always have dull ache cramps to go with it. I also have a tilted uterus. I was on birth control when it started, the SAME birth control I had been on since my son was born, but my obgyn said it was just breakthrough bleeding. I stopped the birth control in August of last year and it is still happening. I have read that sometimes antidepressants can cause it, but the two that I am on (Celexa and Wellbutrin) are on the 'least likely to cause those side effects' list. My grandmother, aunt, and mother all had to have hysterectomies in their late 30's and early 40's so I hope that it is nothing too bad.

question: I have Endomertiosos and another condition called Adenomyosis. I have been plagued by the symptoms from those problems for years now. But recently I have a new symptom and I am worried. A few months ago I started bleeding vaginaly during a bowel movement which still happends often...it also happends during and after intercourse. I have been tested for STD's and everything was all negative I have even had an ultrasound done and nothing. I am waiting to get a pap done. Anyways I am sooo frusterated and have been reading alot about cervical cancer so now I am scared that I might be having symptoms of cervical cancer. But I am also thinking it may just be the endometriosis or that other thing. I did have Human Papiloma Virus years ago...no problems for about 9 years now. Can anyone give me any insight???? I have also been extremely fatigued and have alot of lower back pain. I just don't know what to do and the doctors are not taking me serious. Please help!!!!!
title: Vaginal bleeding after/during sex and with a bowel movement
